body_html:
Maybe I need to clarify things about the init file hack:

When TensorFlow is used from within the repository directory, it finds the __init__.py files and resolves all imports the the repository directory instead of the PIP package.
The problem is that tensorflow/__init__.py imports all submodules including generated ops, which it can't find here.

The same happens when all_opensource_files are linked to runfiles.
body_text:

When TensorFlow is used from within the repository directory, it finds the __init__.py files and resolves all imports the the repository directory instead of the PIP package.

body:
Maybe I need to clarify things about the init file hack:

When TensorFlow is used from within the repository directory, it finds the `__init__.py` files and resolves all imports the the repository directory instead of the PIP package.
The problem is that `tensorflow/__init__.py` imports all submodules including generated ops, which it can't find here.

The same happens when `all_opensource_files` are linked to `runfiles`.
